interface.name: AccessibleExtendedTable
interface.javadoc:
Class AccessibleExtendedTable provides extended information about a user-interface component that presents data in a two-dimensional table format. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleExtendedTable interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext and then calling the{@link AccessibleContext#getAccessibleTable} method. If the return value is not null and the type of the return value is AccessibleExtendedTable, the object supports this interface.
Lynn Monsanto
1.4

Returns the row number of an index in the table.
index the zero-based index in the table. The index is the table cell offset from row == 0 and column == 0.
the zero-based row of the table if one exists; otherwise -1.

Returns the column number of an index in the table.
index the zero-based index in the table. The index is the table cell offset from row == 0 and column == 0.
the zero-based column of the table if one exists; otherwise -1.
